N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 56-7.4 - Establishing each regulated abatement work area

State Regulations
(a) Vacating of regulated abatement work
area. The regulated abatement work area shall be vacated by the occupants and
non-certified personnel, prior to work area preparation, and shall remain
vacated until satisfactory clearance air-sampling results have been achieved or
the asbestos project is complete. (b) Restricted entry. Entry to the regulated
abatement work area shall be restricted to the asbestos contractors involved
with the asbestos project, employees of the asbestos contractors, authorized
visitors, and other public safety personnel. Police and fire officials may
enter the work site and not be subject to this Part only on an emergency
basis. (c) Signs. Asbestos warning
signs, required as per current OSHA regulations shall be posted to restrict
access to the regulated abatement work area at all locations and approaches to
a location where airborne concentrations of asbestos may exceed ambient
background levels. During Phase II A - D activities, signs shall be posted at
locations such that persons may take the necessary protective measures to avoid
potential exposure. Notes
